title: Arduino-Based EMG Prosthetic Arm
narration: Welcome to this presentation on the design and development of a costeffective Arduinobased prosthetic arm. This project aims to create an intuitive and affordable solution for individuals with upperlimb amputations enhancing their quality of life.

title: Introduction to EMG Prosthetics
content:
Electromyography (EMG) uses muscle signals for control.
Arduino-based system for affordability.
Focus on intuitive and natural movements.
image_desc: Prosthetic arm using EMG sensors. Type: illustration
narration: Electromyography or EMG is the key technology behind this prosthetic arm. It involves using sensors to detect electrical signals produced by muscle contractions. By using an Arduinobased system we aim to make this technology more accessible and affordable focusing on creating natural and intuitive movements for the user.

title: System Overview
content:
Multi-channel EMG sensors capture muscle activity.
Lightweight actuators and 3D-printed components.
Wired and wireless communication support.
image_desc: Block diagram of prosthetic arm system. Type: diagram
narration: The system utilizes multichannel EMG sensors to capture the electrical activity from muscle contractions. The prosthetic arm is constructed using lightweight actuators and threeD printed components ensuring a modular and costeffective design. The system also supports both wired and wireless communication allowing for realtime feedback and user control.

title: EMG Signal Processing
content:
Noise reduction techniques: bandpass, notch filters.
Feature extraction: RMS, ZCR, Wavelet Transforms.
Mapping muscle activity to prosthetic movements.
image_desc: EMG signal processing flowchart. Type: diagram
narration: EMG signal processing is crucial for accurate control. Noise reduction techniques such as bandpass and notch filters are used to clean the signals. Feature extraction methods like Root Mean Square Zero Crossing Rate and Wavelet Transforms are then applied to classify and map the muscle activity to specific prosthetic movements.

title: Microcontroller and Amplification
content:
STM32 or Arduino Due for high-accuracy processing.
Real-time feature extraction algorithms.
Low-noise amplifiers for signal clarity.
narration: The microcontroller either an STM32 or Arduino Due is responsible for processing the EMG signals with high accuracy. Realtime feature extraction algorithms are implemented to ensure precise interpretation of muscle activity. Lownoise amplifiers are used to enhance signal clarity and reduce interference.

title: Machine Learning for Movement Classification
content:
Support Vector Machine (SVM).
k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN).
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).
image_desc: Machine learning classification diagram. Type: diagram
narration: To achieve highaccuracy movement classification machine learning algorithms are employed. These include Support Vector Machines kNearest Neighbors and Convolutional Neural Networks. These algorithms learn from the extracted features to accurately predict and execute the user's intended movements.

title: Sensory Feedback Integration
content:
Haptic feedback mechanisms.
Proprioceptive feedback mechanisms.
Enhancing user experience and control.
image_desc: Sensory feedback mechanisms in prosthetic arm. Type: illustration
narration: The system integrates sensory feedback through haptic and proprioceptive mechanisms. Haptic feedback provides tactile sensations while proprioceptive feedback gives the user a sense of the arm's position and movement in space. This integration enhances the user experience and improves movement control.

title: Expected Results
content:
Classification accuracy of around ninety-two percent.
Response time of one hundred fifty to one hundred eighty milliseconds.
Real-time, seamless interaction.
image_desc: Graph showing classification accuracy. Type: graph
narration: We expect the prosthetic arm to achieve a classification accuracy of around ninetytwo percent ensuring precise control over essential movements. The arm is designed to operate with a response time of one hundred fifty to one hundred eighty milliseconds facilitating realtime and seamless interaction for the user.

title: Key Movements
content:
Hand opening and closing.
Wrist rotation.
Other essential movements.
image_desc: Prosthetic arm demonstrating hand and wrist movements. Type: photograph
narration: The prosthetic arm is designed to perform essential movements such as hand opening and closing as well as wrist rotation. These movements are crucial for performing daily tasks and improving the user's independence.

title: User Trials and Regulatory Compliance
content:
User trials for comfort and usability.
Compliance with local standards.
High performance for Indian patients.
image_desc: User testing prosthetic arm. Type: photograph
narration: User trials are conducted to ensure the system offers high comfort and usability. The system is also designed to comply with local regulatory standards ensuring it meets the necessary safety and performance requirements for Indian patients with upperlimb amputations.

title: Benefits of the System
content:
Affordable and accessible technology.
Intuitive and natural control.
Improved quality of life.
image_desc: Person using prosthetic arm for daily tasks. Type: photograph
narration: The benefits of this system include providing affordable and accessible technology for those in need. The intuitive and natural control offered by the EMGbased system allows for a seamless user experience. Ultimately this prosthetic arm aims to improve the quality of life for individuals with upperlimb amputations.

title: Conclusion
content:
Caption: Affordable and intuitive prosthetic solution.
Narration:
In conclusion, this Arduino-based EMG prosthetic arm represents a significant step towards providing affordable, intuitive, and effective solutions for individuals with upper-limb amputations, enhancing their independence and quality of life.

narration: In conclusion this Arduinobased EMG prosthetic arm represents a significant step towards providing affordable intuitive and effective solutions for individuals with upperlimb amputations enhancing their independence and quality of life.
